lines.text: I fell in love with a beautiful woman who believed a man was not a complete lover unless he knew how to tango.
She didn't give you much choice.
lines.character: Cheryl King, Owner of Candy Store

lines.text: I took lessons for years.
And what was this young lady's vocation?
She was a tango instructor.
Let's find out, you son of a bitch. Draw!
My men will cut you to pieces.
Not before I shoot out your eyes.
[They glare at each other. People move away]
Another time.
[nods]
Would you really have shot him?
lines.character: Cheryl King, Owner of Candy Store

lines.text: No.
Why not?
lines.character: Cheryl King, Owner of Candy Store

lines.text: I'm not packing a gun.

Wait a minute, Wyatt, there's something we gotta get sorted out here. I threatened to rope him behind my horse and drag him, then you waltz in pretty as you please and threaten to kill him. I don't like being out-threatened.
Sorry. Won't happen again.
It's all true, give or take a lie or two.
She's a grand girl.
She's a grand 26 year old girl. I could have done myself permanent injury.
How come you told Cheryl where I'm staying?
Because she asked. And I figured if she asked you, you'd tell her.

[Blackworth and Kieffer hear some noise coming from the kitchen of the "Kit Kat" club]
Do you have a cat?
Not that big.
[last title card]
...and that's the way it really happened.
Give or take a lie or two.
Will you sleep with me?
lines.character: Cheryl King, Owner of Candy Store

lines.text: Cheryl, I'm old enough to be your father.
Wyatt, you're old enough to be my grandfather. Now answer the question.
lines.character: Cheryl King, Owner of Candy Store

lines.text: Martha Jane Canary was a dear and selfless woman, but she looked like an unmade bed. This young lady's far to pretty.
